name: Serious Salsa: (Not Exactly) My Uncle's Salsa
description: The first homemade salsa I ever made was my uncle's--a simple tomato-based affair, made with tomatoes, jalapeños, onions, and cilantro. He also throws in a generous dose of chili powder, his secret ingredient that gives it a Tex-Mex kick.
recipeIngredient: 1 can tomatoes (28-ounce; or about a pound of fresh Roma tomatoes, peeled and chopped)

2 Serrano peppers, diced (or you can substitute 2 jalapeños, which are milder.) Be sure and either wear gloves or wash your hands immediately after chopping the peppers so you don’t burn other parts of yourself.
2 tablespoons of chili powder (add more to taste, if you like)

recipeInstructions.text: Put all ingredients in the blender and blend until smooth. Taste and adjust spices if needed.
